en.openingScene01: Hey there recruit! I know you have just completed your training as a Multiplication Mastermind (MM), but we need your help ASAP!
en.openingScene02: Our planet's resources have been pillaged by a greedy robot called a Scion.
en.openingScene03: Scions travel the universe in search of resources to steal because they don't know how to use multiplication!
en.openingScene04: We need to get our resources back. The best way to do this is to help out the neighboring planets.
en.openingScene05: They will have access to the resources the Scion took from us. Perhaps they will give them to you as payment for helping them out.
en.openingScene06: Once we acquire all the necessary resources we can deal with that pesky Scion!
en.scionOpening02: I want to let you know that you will never catch me! I will never learn to multiply! Its too scary!
en.openingScene07: Alright double M. Lets get this show on the road! I'll see you at Home Base.
en.HomeBaseIntro2: From here you can navigate to each of the surrounding planets. First lets go help our friends in the cargo ship.
en.HomeBaseIntro3: I believe the Scion already got their fuel, so bring some fuel tanks. Lets go!
en.cargoShip2: That Scion came and stole our fuel. He said something about having all the fuel means he'll never have to learn multiplication..?
en.cargoShip4: Anyway. Me and my crew are floating aimlessly out here now!
en.cargoShip5: Our ship has 4 engines. Each engine can hold 2 tanks of fuel.
en.cargoShip6: Using repeated addition, we can determine how many fuel tanks we will need to fill up our ship!
en.cargoShip7: Repeated addition is the same thing as multiplication. The multiplicative equation for this situation looks like this.
en.cargoShip8: 4 X 2 = 8 is the exact same thing as saying 4 groups of 2 is a total of 8.
en.cargoShip9: Using this approach, which equation is the repeated addition equation for 4 X 2 = 8?
en.cargoShipCorrect: Precisely! We need 2 fuel tanks 4 times!
en.cargoShipIncorrect: Not Quite. Remeber, 4 X 2 = 8 also means 4 groups of 2 = 8.
en.cargoShipIncorrect1: Which equation shows four groups of 2 fuel cans?
en.cargoShipCorrect1: Thank you for helping us! We heard the Scion stole from your home planet. We want you to have these to say thank you.
en.repeatAdditionInstructions: Drag the correct equation to the empty slot below. Which equation is the repeated addition equation for 4 X 2 = 8?
en.welcomeBackToBase1: Welcome back recruit. You did awesome out there.
en.welcomeBackToBase2: We got pencils from the cargo ship. Maybe we can catch the Scion and teach it multiplication!
en.welcomeBackToBase3: Lets get some more supplies from the other 2 planets. First we need to help our reptilian friends on Cavity Planet! Lets go!
en.planet1intro2: Depite our name, we take pride in our gorgeous teeth!
en.planet1intro3: The Scion who has been giving you trouble visited us, but took all of our toothbrushes!
en.planet1intro4: We have 5 families here. Each family has 5 members, so therefore, the Scion stole 25 toothbrushes.
en.planet1intro5: You could also say that we need 5 groups of 5 toothbrushes.
en.planet1intro6: Can you tell me which of these multiplicative sentences means 5 groups of 5 toothbrushes?
en.planet1instructionalpanel: Which of the following best illustrates that 5 groups of 5 = 25 total toothbrushes?
en.wrongAnswerDialogP1: Hmm. Not exactly. Remember, we have 5 families here with 5 members each.
en.wrongAnswerDialogP2: We need 25 toothbrushes. We can look at this problem like this.
en.wrongAnswerDialogP3: There are 5 groups of people with 5 people per group.
en.wrongAnswerDialogP4: Which mulitiplicative sentence makes the most sense in this situation?
en.correctAnswerDialogP1: Exactly! 5 X 5 means there are 5 groups of 5!
en.correctAnswerDialogP2: An easy way to remember that is to think of the multiplication symbol as meaning 'groups of'.
en.correctAnswerDialogP3: You did great! Thanks again. Now we can all go back to keeping or teeth nice and sharp and clean!
en.correctAnswerDialogP4: I want you to have this paper. I heard the Scion came and took all your planet's multiplication resources.
en.correctAnswerDialogP5: I know it isn't much, but I think you could put this paper to better use than we can.
en.welcomeBackToBase4: Awesome work! Now we have pencils and paper.
en.welcomeBackToBase5: Now all we need to do is catch that Scion and teach him how to multiply!
en.welcomeBackToBase6: Lets check out Emilia's planet and see what they need! Surely Emilia has some ideas on how we can catch him.
en.emiliaIntro1: Hiya! The name is Emilia. Yes. Like Emilia Earhart, but the space version.
en.emiliaIntro2: Yea Yea yea, the Scion came here too. They didn't steal anything though.
en.emiliaIntro3: They just trashed my planet and left! I hear you're looking to catch him.
en.emiliaIntro4: Well, you may be in luck. All the trash he left could easily be used to build a spaceship.
en.shipBuilder1: Lets get to work building this ship.
en.shipBuilder2: Click the buttons on the left side of the screen to build that part of the ship.
en.shipBuilder3: Get ready though. To build the ship you are going to have to answer some tough questions. Lets go!
en.shipBuilder4: Awesome job. Thats one purdy ship I'll tell you what!
en.shipBuilder5: Lets go get that Scion and teach him how to multiply.
en.scionBattle0: HAHAHA you will NEVER catch me! Multiplication is too scary! I'll never learn it!
en.scionBattle1: Double M, we need to slow that Scion down or else they will get away!
en.scionBattle2: You really think you stand a chance in that tiny ship?! HAHAHAHAHA...
en.scionFight1: Well well well. It seems you are able to keep up with me even though your ship is so small!
en.scionFight3: Dont listen to her! You're doing terribly! One of my engines is gone!
en.scionFight4: We only want to help you! Multiplication is critical to your survival!
en.scionFight5: Lets fix the Scions engine. They have 4 engines total. 2 on either side of the ship. Which multiplicative equation represents 2 groups of 2 engines?
en.question1Text: Which multiplicative equation represents 2 groups of 2 engines?
en.question1TextWrong: Not exactly. Which one means 2 groups of 2 makes 4?
en.scionFight6: Ohhh I get it. 2 groups of 2 makes 4! Still.. Just because I learned that doesnt mean I want to learn more! Go away!
en.scionFight7: Keep up the pressure! We're getting the message across. The Scion almost knows how to multiply!
en.scionFight8: I dont think our lasers are getting the message across. We need to double their power!
en.scionFight9: We are firing 1 laser at a time right now. If we double the laser that means we will have 2 lasers firing at once!
en.scionFight10: Determine which mutliplicative sentence best fits this situation? 1 laser becoming 2.
en.question2Text: Which multiplicative sentence means 1 group of 2 lasers?
en.question2TextWrong: Not quite. GIve it another try. Which multiplicative sentence means that we doubled the laser?
en.scionFight11: HA! You may have powered up your laser, but lets see if you can hit me with them after I fly into this asteroid storm!
en.scionFight13: You are pretty good with that laser. It looks like I have to resort to plan B.
en.scionFight14: I am going to unleash my fleet of Mini Scion Bots! MINIONS... ATTACK!
en.scionFight15: We were expecting this. It looks like this ship only has 14 Mini Scion Bots.
en.scionFight16: Lets knock them down in groups of 2. That means we should only have 7 groups.
en.scionFight17: Which multiplicative sentence best describes 7 groups of 2?
en.question3Text: Which multiplicative sentence best describes 7 groups of 2 Mini Scion Bots?
en.question3TextWrong: Not quite. Give it aother try. The Scion's ship has 7 groups of 2 Mini Scion Bots.
en.question3TextRight: Correct! Now lets knock down these Mini Scion Bots and catch up with that Scion! We've almost taught it to multiply!
en.finalScionDialog: NO! You destroyed all of my mini bots!
en.finalScionDialog2: Thats right! Just stop running from us! We want to teach you how to multiply. It will make your life so much easier!
en.finalScionDialog3: FINE! I'm going to land it at your Home Base. I'll meet you there.
en.welcomeBackToBase7: We finally got the Scion to agree to learn to multiply. Lets get to work using the paper and pencils we got for helping our neighbors.
en.shipBuildQuestionCockpit: Match the following repeated addition equations to their multiplicative equation counterparts.
en.shipBuildQuestionBody: Match the following multiplicative sentences to their description.
en.shipBuildQuestionWings: Match the following multiplicative sentences to their repeated addition counterparts.
en.shipBuildQuestionEngine: Match the following multiplicative sentences to their repeated addition counterparts.
